intro: Utricularia × siakujiiensis, commonly known as the Siakujiiensis bladderwort, is a hybrid aquatic plant belonging to the family Lentibulariaceae. It is characterized by its small, delicate leaves and specialized bladder-like structures used for trapping prey. This plant is typically found in shallow, nutrient-rich water bodies, where it can thrive in both freshwater and brackish environments. Its morphology reflects adaptations for nutrient acquisition in low-fertility aquatic habitats. The hybrid nature of Utricularia × siakujiiensis suggests genetic contributions from multiple parent species, enhancing its ecological versatility.
